title: Generative AI on Vertex AI - 提示設計簡介
abstract:
# Generative AI on Vertex AI - 提示設計簡介
提示設計是創建提示以從語言模型引出所需回覆的過程。編寫結構化良好的提示是確保從語言模型獲得準確優質回覆的重要環節。本頁面介紹了一些基本概念、策略和最佳實踐，可幫助您開始設計提示。
content:
## 什麼是提示
提示是提交到語言模型以接收回復的自然語言請求。提示可以包含問題、說明、語境信息、樣本以及模型完成或繼續的部分輸入。模型收到提示後，可以生成文本、嵌入、代碼、圖片、視頻和音樂等，具體取決於所用的模型類型。
### 提示內容類型
提示可以包含以下一種或多種內容類型：
- [輸入（必需）](#input) 
- [上下文（可選）](#context) 
- [示例（可選）](#examples) 輸入是您希望模型爲其提供回覆的提示中的文本，它是必需的內容類型。輸入可以是模型回答的問題（問題輸入）、模型執行的任務（任務輸入）、模型操作的實體（實體輸入），或模型完成或繼續的部分輸入（補全輸入）。
問題輸入是您向提供回答的模型詢問的問題。
| 0                                                                                     |
|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 提示： What's a good name for a flower shop that specializes in selling bouquets of dried flowers? 回答： 1. Everlasting Blooms 2. Timeless Petals 3. Dried Flower Paradise 4. Eternal Flora 5. Vintage Floral Treasures 6. Rustic Bloom Gallery 7. Ardent Adornment 8. Potpourri Dreams 9. Dried Daisy Days 10. Forever Floral Art (gemini-pro) |
任務輸入是您希望模型執行的任務。例如，您可以指示模型爲您提供某個主題的想法或建議。
| 0                                                                                                                         |
|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 提示： Give me a simple list of things that I must bring on a camping trip. 回答： 1. Tent 2. Sleeping bag 3. Sleeping pad 4. Pillow 5. Lantern or flashlight 6. Headlamp 7. Camp stove 8. Fuel for camp stove 9. Cooking pot and utensils 10. Food and water 11. First aid kit 12. Sunscreen 13. Insect repellent 14. Toiletries 15. Toilet paper 16. Fire starter 17. Map 18. Compass 19. Whistle 20. Multi-tool 21. Tarpaulin 22. Rope 23. Garbage bags 24. Camera 25. Binoculars (gemini-pro) |
實體輸入是模型對其執行操作（例如分類或彙總）的對象。添加說明對這種類型的輸入有幫助。
| 0                                     |
|:--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 提示： Classify the following items as [large, small]. Elephant Mouse Snail 回答： - Elephant: Large - Mouse: Small - Snail: Small (gemini-pro) |
補全輸入是您希望模型補全或繼續往下寫的文本。
| 0                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|:--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 提示： Some simple strategies for overcoming writer's block include 回答： 1. **Take a Break:** Step away from your writing for a bit. Go for a walk, listen to music, or do something else that helps you relax and clear your mind. When you come back to your writing, you may find that your thoughts are more organized and your ideas are flowing more easily. 2. **Change Your Environment:** Sometimes, a change of scenery can help spark creativity. Try writing in a different location, such as a coffee shop, a library, or a park. Being in a new environment can help you see things from a different perspective and break out of your writer's block. 3. **Freewrite or Brainstorm:** Set a timer for 10-15 minutes and just write whatever comes to mind, without worrying about grammar or spelling. This can help you get started and generate new ideas. You can also try brainstorming by writing down a list of words or phrases that are related to your topic. This can help you to free associate and come up with new ideas. 4. **Read or Research:** Sometimes, the best way to overcome writer's block is to read or research your topic. Reading can help you to learn new things and get inspired. Research can help you to gather information and facts that you can use in your writing. 5. **Talk to Someone:** Talk to a friend, family member, or writing partner about what you're struggling with. Sometimes, just talking about your ideas can help you to clarify them and see them from a new perspective. You can also ask for feedback and suggestions, which can help you to move forward with your writing. 6. **Try a Different Writing Style:** If you're stuck in a rut, try experimenting with a different writing style. For example, if you're used to writing formal essays, try writing a poem or a short story. Changing your writing style can help you to break out of your comfort zone and come up with new ideas. 7. **Set a Deadline:** Sometimes, the best way to overcome writer's block is to set a deadline for yourself. This can help you to focus and motivate yourself to finish your writing. When you know that you have a deadline, you're more likely to start writing and keep going until you're finished. (text-bison@001) |
語境可以是以下項之一：
- 指定模型行爲方式的說明。
- 模型使用或引用來生成回覆的信息。
當您需要向模型提供信息時，請在提示中添加語境信息，或者將回復的邊界限制爲僅提示中的內容。
| 0                                                  |
|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 提示： Marbles: Color: red Number: 12 Color: blue Number: 28 Color: yellow Number: 15 Color: green Number: 17 How many green marbles are there? 回答： There are 17 green marbles. (text-bison@001) |
樣本是您在提示中添加的輸入-輸出對，以便爲模型提供理想的回覆樣本。在提示中添加樣本是自定義回覆格式的有效策略。
| 0                                                               |
|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 提示： Classify the following. Options: - red wine - white wine Text: Chardonnay The answer is: white wine Text: Cabernet The answer is: red wine Text: Moscato The answer is: white wine Text: Riesling The answer is: 回答： white wine (text-bison@001) |
